verses.verse: And when He got up from there, He went to the borders of Judea across to the other side of the Jordan River. And crowds again traveled together to Him, and as He had been accustomed to, He was teaching them again.
And when the Separatists came forward, they asked Him if it is permitted for a husband to dismiss a wife, trying to cause trouble with Him.
When Jesus answered, He said to them, "What did Moses demand to you?"
The Separatists said, "Moses gave permission to write a scroll of divorce and to dismiss."
And when Jesus responded, He said to them, "Toward your hardheartedness He wrote you this demand.
But from the beginning of creation, God made them male and female.
On account of this, a person will leave his father and mother down there and be stuck like glue to his wife.
And the two will be in one physical body. In such a way, they are no longer two, but one physical body.
So what God strapped together, a person must not separate."
And in the house again, His students asked Him about the same thing.
And He says to them, "Whoever dismisses his wife and marries another is cheating on her.
And if a wife dismisses her husband and is married to another, she is cheating on her husband."
And they were bringing young children to Him so that He might touch them, but the students were forbidding the ones bringing them.
When Jesus saw it, He was infuriated and said to them, "Leave the young children to be coming to Me, and don't hinder them. You see, the empire of God is made up of these types of children.
Amen, I tell you, whoever does not accept the empire of God as a young child will not in any way go into it."
And after He took them in His arms, placing His hands on them, He was conferring prosperity on them.
And as He was traveling out to a road, after one person ran up and kneeled to Him, he was asking Him, "Good Teacher, what will I do so that I might inherit life that spans all time?"
Jesus said to him, "Why are you calling Me good? No one is good except One, God.
You know the demands: you will not cheat on your spouse, you will not murder, you will not steal, you will not lie when you are a witness, you will not rob, you must value your father and mother."
When the person answered, He said to Him, "Teacher, all these things I observed from my youth."

When Jesus looked at him, He loved him and said to him, "One thing is lacking for you. Go back. Sell as much as you have, give to the poor (and you will have treasure in heaven), and come here; follow Me after you pick up the cross."
After being disappointed over the answer, the person went away sad. You see, he was a person who had many properties.
And after Jesus looks around, He says to His students, "How hard it will be for the people who have the stacks of money as they go into the empire of God."

The students were bewildered over His messages. When Jesus responds again, He says to them, "Children, how hard it is for the people who have been confident based on the stacks of money to go into the empire of God!
It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of the needle than for a rich man to go into the empire of God."
The students were being impressed much more, saying to themselves, "And who is able to be rescued?"
When Jesus looks at them, He says, "Beside people it is impossible, but not beside God. You see, all things are possible beside God."
And Peter began to be saying to Him, "Look, we left everything and followed You."

When Jesus answered, He said, "Amen, I tell you, there is no one who left a house, or brothers, or sisters, or a father, or a mother, or a wife, or children, or fields on account of Me and the good news,

except he will receive a hundred times as much now in this time (houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and fields) with persecutions and in the span of time, the coming one, life that spans all time.
Many who are first will be last, and the last first."

They were on the road walking up to Jerusalem, Jesus was going ahead of them, they were bewildered, and as they followed, they were afraid. And when He took the Twelve alongside of Him again, He began to be telling them the things that were going to be transpiring with Him.

"Look, I am walking up to Jerusalem, and the Son of the Person will be turned over to the head priests and the Old Testament transcribers. And they will find Him guilty with death and turn Him over to the non-Jews.
And they will mock Him, whip Him, spit at Him, kill Him, and on the third day, He will be gotten up."
And James and John (the sons of Zebedee) are traveling to Him, saying, "Teacher, we want that whatever we will ask, You will do for us."
But Jesus said to them, "What do you want Me to do for you?"
The brothers said to Him, "Give us so that we might be seated, one at places to the right of You and one at places to the left of You in Your magnificence."
Jesus said to them, "You do not realize what you are asking for. Are you able to drink the cup that I am drinking and to be submerged in the submersion that I am submerged in?"
The brothers said to Him, "We are able." But Jesus said to them, "The cup that I drink, you will certainly drink, and the submersion that I am submerged in, you will be submerged in,
but the right to be seated at places to the right of Me and at places to the left of Me is not Mine to give. But it is for the people it has been readied for."
And when the ten heard, they began to be getting infuriated about James and John.
When Jesus calls for them, He says to them, "You realize that the people who seem to be heading the non-Jews act like masters over them and their huge people put themselves in authority over them.
This is not how it will be among you. But whoever wants to become huge among you will be your servant.
And whoever of you wants to become first will be everyone's slave.
You see, the Son of the Person also did not come to be served, but to serve and to give His soul as a payment for the release of many."
And they are coming into Jericho. And as He, His students, and an adequate crowd traveled out from Jericho, a son of Timaeus, blind Bartimaeus, was sitting along the road begging.
And when he hears that it is Jesus, the Nazarene, he began to be yelling and to be saying, "The Son of David, Jesus, show me forgiving kindness."
And many were forbidding him so that he would be silent, but the beggar was yelling much more, "Son of David, show me forgiving kindness."
And when Jesus stood still, He said to holler for him. And they are hollering for the blind man, saying to him, "Be courageous. Get up. He is hollering for you."
After throwing off his robe, when the man stood up, he went to Jesus.
And when Jesus responded, He says to him, "What do you want that I would do for you?" The blind man said to Him, "Rabboni (Great Rabbi), that I might see again."
Jesus said to him, "Go back. Your trust has rescued you." And right away he saw again and was following Jesus on the road.
